channel.title: First time Gateway and Workstation password changes
channel.description: Have read posts regarding password changing. I am a rank beginner at this level so if some one could go through the password changing routine, step by step I may be able to move on from here. Terms like root/user,user password etc make no sense to me. Help would be really appreciated. I´m not dumb, don´t answer that!!, I´m just old. Thanks in advance.

item.title: First time Gateway and Workstation password changes
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Hi, thank you for the feedback. This will hopefully help us to clarify documentation.

Whonix is based on Debian.

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/About#Based_on_Debian

Therefore often terminology is the same as for Debian, or in a wider sense same as for Linux and often even same as for any linux distribution.

root means superuser or administrator.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superuser

The superuser in Linux is in most (like Whonix) if not all cases called root.

For better anonymity, the non-superuser, normal user account is called user.

I’ve modified https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Post_Install_Advice#Change_Passwords a bit more more clarify right now. Hope that helps.

Read full topic
item.source: First time Gateway and Workstation password changes
